author: Ohcrap75
title: Drop Rate
text: 1 Jamison Crowder WAS 26 24 92% 2 Doug Baldwin SEA 26 23 88% 3 Cole Beasley DAL 26 23 88% 4 Mike Wallace MIN 24 20 83% 5 James Jones GB 23 19 83% 6 Larry Fitzgerald ARZ 44 36 82% 7 Allen Hurns JAX 35 28 80% 8 John Brown ARZ 30 24 80% 9 Jermaine Kearse SEA 23 18 78% 10 Randall Cobb GB 39 29 74% 11 Tavon Austin STL 22 16 73% 12 Jeremy Maclin KC 51 37 73% 13 Darrius Heyward PIT 25 17 68% 14 Calvin Johnson DET 50 33 66% 15 Steve Smith Sr. BLT 46 30 65% 16 Brandin Cooks NO 40 26 65% 17 Lance Moore DET 22 14 64% 18 Golden Tate DET 43 27 63% 19 Travis Benjamin CLE 38 22 58% 20 Michael Crabtree OAK 47 27 57% Look at this catchable rate for those same players. Shows that Palmer is making good throws. Palmer makes the machine work. John Brown is good, don't get me wrong, but QB's make receivers in this league. It's no different than anyone Peyton Manning has thrown to, including Demerius Thomas, he wasn't even on the radar as a great receiver until Peyton started chucking it to him. TY Hilton wasn't on the radar either. Same with Reggie Wayne and Marvin Harrison. Talent, yes, HOF #'s before Manning, no. Palmer is playing at an exceptional level. His arm strength and decision-making seem the same to me, but he's excelled in his lower body. His footwork in the pocket is outstanding. I'd say it's better than he's ever played, regarding his feet, hips and body positioning. It's not just about moving up in the pocket, he's reforming the pocket by stepping side-wise and up and putting himself in position to make good throws. This is the best I've ever seen him play.
